posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hi everyone

Thought I would give myself a challenge and see if I could make a build which:


- has devastating critical
- has maximal critical hit range (ie keen WM scimitar with improved critical - threat range 10-20, or 55% of rolls)
- has 4 attacks per round (ie BAB 26+)
- aims to have the highest unbuffed AB possible with these requirements (say, 50) - to ensure threat rolls have the best chance of being converted to critical hits
- aims to have the highest unbuffed strength score possible with these requirements (say 40)
- is still fun to play


Other Bard/RDD/WM builds with a similar idea:

- Whirling Death by Torias (more bard less WM, has a unbuffed AB of 37)
- Lord An by vozhd (uses a spear, AB 47, Str 34)
- Smash Mouth by Bad213Boy (greataxe, AB 48, Str 38, no dev crit)
- Fury Ignited by Highlander44 (AB 47, Str 34, no dev crit, EDR III)
- Draconic Warlord by Bad213Boy (rapier, AB 48, Str 36, no dev crit)
- Fly on the Wings of Pain (more bard less WM, unbuffed AB 42)

I would honestly love to fit Blind Fight into the build but there isn't enough space for the feat with the above requirements.

if you don't like dev crit or its disabled I would swap Overwhelming Critical and Devastating Critical for Blind Fight, Heavy Armor Proficiency and/or Armor Skin, and swap the order of the feats so the pre-epic feats are taken sooner.



Anyway wanted to see what you thought, any suggestions?

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
I have attempted this combination before, too, but I wasn't happy with it.  It is really hard to make a good build with these classes because it is so feat-starved.

Here are some ideas for a non-Dev-Crit version.  Replace Weapon Proficiency with Blind Fight and use a Morning Star.  Start with STR 17, DEX 14, and CON 12, and replace Power Attack, Cleave, and Great Cl;eave with 3 Great STR feats (or 1 Great STR and Knockdown and Improved Knockdown).  Use the WM feats for Epic Weapon Focus, Armor Skin, Epic Prowess, and Epic Toughness, in that order.

This will give you +1 AB (or unchanged AB and IKD), +3 AC, and 60 more health.  You would have much fewer crits, but blunt damage for those pesky slash-resistant enemies, and Blind Fight for those sneaky enemies.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks guys for your comments on a challenging but powerful class combination. Thanks Stag for putting a link up to your previous adventures trying to make a WM/RDD build! :)

I thought I would make some adjustments. 

The original build is way too feat starved to make dev crit an enjoyable combination with it (its pretty much click on enemy, walk up to enemy, kill em with AB 50 / 40 Str and dev crit, pretty dull), so I dropped it, freeing up a whole bunch of feats.

It will also make your party members happy by not insta-killing everything in sight. I've formed a view that Dev Crit is acceptable for a solo player but not really great for parties.

I took Empyre65's starting stat suggestion of Str 17 / Dex 14 / Cons 12 which was a very good suggestion.

In addition I thought one should take Elf for the delightful Keen Senses feat, with the remaining skill points turn the build into an Elven Draconic Seeker. With no exp penalties to worry about, why not. Also grants longsword weapon proficiency which eventually the build can cast keen weapon on it, 3 times / day, and access to longbows which are great ranged weapons. 

With Base 50AB, Base 40 Str, 400hp+ and a whole bunch of search / spot / listen skills buffed by racial bonuses nothing is going to miss this elf's notice, and is going to get punished with weapon master/keen weapon criticals/UMD buffs when detected. It also gets +14 AC from Tumble, RDD and Armor Skin. 

With Dex buffed to 18, one can wear a chainshirt and not really miss wearing full plate. Lots of elven chainmails out there with reduced arcane spell failure allowing one to maybe cast a few bardic spells in them (perhaps unequip that tower first though). If Dex can be capped, then one could even wear padded armor, albeit a little risky with no uncanny dodge.

Spellcraft is 1(4) so that when bard song is active (granting +1 to skills), spell craft goes to 5 (for +1 to saves against spells). Very cheesy

A human version can go greatsword or scimitar by taking Weapon Proficiency Martial early on, but lots of modules have elf bonuses (like special elf societies where elves get special treatment), and not everything is crit vulnerable. Human would grant a whole bunch of skill points, which could go into maxing Taunt/Concentration or adding trapping skills. I'm keen to finally create a few elves to play. Not sure it is necessarily stronger to go Human.

Finally with a base AB with non longsword melee weapons he can equip  of 42, he could equip other weapons and kill things albeit limited to simple and elven proficiencies 

Anyway thought I would post this updated build for review, in the unfinished build section to see if there were any other comments to make, tough work to make a build with this combo enjoyable but I think I'm getting very close here

Edit: changed the weapon to rapier. see discussion below. it has a much better crit range even if I can't cast keen weapon on it

Hmm I chose it because one can't keen weapon a rapier 

That being said, now that I think about it, there are a few keen rapiers in modules etc, also if one can socket a rapier on WoG with a deadly gem it wouldn't be a bad idea....


Great comment Web!

addit:
Rapier 18-20 -> 15-20 (improved crit) -> 12-20 (improved crit + WM crit range) -> 9-20 (keen rapier (from weapon only), improved crit and WM crit range)

Longsword 19-20 -> 17-20 (improved crit) -> 15-20 (improved crit + WM crit range) -> 13-20 (keen weapon, improved crit, WM crit range)

So even without keen weapon, rapier is stronger. Keen Weapon makes it absolute overkill. 

So yes Rapier is more optimal based on the above math.

Thanks so much for your comment web. Definitely was in the spirit of improvement!

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hehe a 500hp two handed beast! Str 38 can be capped at the mythical number of 50 :) Human is great for the skill points too, as one can see, there is room for more UMD, and Taunt and trapping skills

I think spears are quite underrated, crit 20/x3 is similar to a greataxe, which is buffed to 17-20/x4 in the build. greataxes just have a higher base damage (1d8 vs 1d12), which when a character has a very high strength, strength & crits are the major contributor to damage (+21 to 30 in your build, depending on whether Str is capped or not), and matters little, the only practical advantage of the greataxe over spear is the ability to cast Keen Weapon on it

I erm have a very significant weakness for Web's rapier idea though. Being able to crit 60% of hits with a 9-20 threat roll for x3 sounds pretty sweet
